stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Mongolian Language Phishing Email
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 24 December 2014, a Mongolian language phishing email was sent from n.biligbaatar@hushmail.com to a U.S. Government Department. The email had the subject "Zul sariin bayriin mend" and the malicious attachment Zul sariin bayriin mend.doc (MD5: d4da3a747e8b9b4be1c39a900e652909). The malware communicates with keep.regebky.com (137.175.36.13).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
---- BEGIN SAMPLE EMAIL ---- Received: from barracuda ([10.3.100.16]:41844 helo=barracuda.barracudanetworks.com) by webmail.[REDACTED].mn with esmtp (Exim 4.82) (envelope-from <n.biligbaatar@hushmail.com>) id 1Y3fkm-0008DV-L4 for [REDACTED]; Wed, 24 Dec 2014 14:49:04 +0800 X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1419403996-07a43b10d7107f0001-XWGL8t Received: from smtp10.hushmail.com (smtp10a.hushmail.com [65.39.178.239]) by barracuda.barracudanetworks.com with ESMTP id APoZziH9nyWrC6DU for [REDACTED]; Wed, 24 Dec 2014 14:53:16 +0800 (ULAT) X-Barracuda-Envelope-From: n.biligbaatar@hushmail.com X-Barracuda-Apparent-Source-IP: 65.39.178.239 X-CheckPoint: {549A62DB-4C-20A0A0A-C0000000} Received: from smtp10.hushmail.com (smtp10a.hushmail.com [65.39.178.239]) by smtp10.hushmail.com (Postfix) with SMTP id 42078C0113 for [REDACTED]; Wed, 24 Dec 2014 06:53:14 +0000 (UTC) Received: from smtp.hushmail.com (w7.hushmail.com [65.39.178.32]) by smtp10.hushmail.com (Postfix) with ESMTP; Wed, 24 Dec 2014 06:53:13 +0000 (UTC) Received: by smtp.hushmail.com (Postfix, from userid 99) id 87B0920B58; Wed, 24 Dec 2014 06:53:13 +0000 (UTC) MIME-Version: 1.0 Date: Tue, 23 Dec 2014 22:53:13 -0800 To: [REDACTED] Cc: [REDACTED] Subject: Zul sariin bayriin mend From: n.biligbaatar@hushmail.com X-ASG-Orig-Subj: Zul sariin bayriin mend Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="=_cd4dde6163bf9daa340e305519f146a2" Message-Id: <20141224065313.87B0920B58@smtp.hushmail.com> X-Barracuda-Connect: smtp10a.hushmail.com[65.39.178.239] X-Barracuda-Start-Time: 1419403996 X-Barracuda-URL: http://10.3.100.16:8000/cgi-mod/mark.cgi X-Virus-Scanned: by bsmtpd at barracudanetworks.com X-Barracuda-BRTS-Status: 1 X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: -1001.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=-1001.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=3.5 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=6.0 X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any abuse report X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - [REDACTED] X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - [REDACTED] X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [47 12] / [47 12] X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - hushmail.com X-Get-Message-Sender-Via: webmail.[REDACTED].mn: redirect/forwarder owner [REDACTED] -> [REDACTED] ---- END EMAIL HEADER ----
---- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ---- Subject: Zul sariin bayriin mend From: n.biligbaatar@hushmail.com Date: Tue, 23 Dec 2014 22:53:13 -0800 To: [REDACTED]> SMTP To: [REDACTED]; Cc: [REDACTED], [REDACTED] Date: Wed Dec 24 06:53:13 GMT 2014 Attachment: Zul sariin bayriin mend.doc Attachment MD5: d4da3a747e8b9b4be1c39a900e652909
Sain baina uu . Tand zul sariin bayriin bolon shine jiliin mendiig hurgey. Khundetgesen N.Biligbaatar ---- END EMAIL BODY ----

When this file is opened with Microsoft Word, it performs the following actions: - Exploits vulnerability CVE-2012-0158 - Installs xpsfiltsvcs.dll (MD5: D1B27411AE5D20B6520477D0D04FCFF1) in the user's Local Temp directory - Modifies the System Registry to enable persistence for xpsfiltsvcs.dll to execute the next time the user logs on - Terminates Word
File added: C:\Documents and Settings\[User]\Local Settings\Temp\xpsfiltsvcs.dll
Registry value added: HKEY_USERS\S-1-5-21-1454471165-1644491937-839522115-1003\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\xpsfiltsvcs = rundll32.exe C:\DOCUME~1\[User]\LOCALS~1\Temp\xpsfiltsvcs.dll,XpsRegisterServer
When this .dll is executed, it installs Awl.txt (MD5: C70F2812B22A222547EC5C551D3FC916) in the user's Local Temp directory, executes it, and terminates.

This file was installed by xpsfiltsvcs.dll (MD5: D1B27411AE5D20B6520477D0D04FCFF1). According to the report, this .dll was likely given a .txt filename extension in an attempt to disguise it from being and executable file. When executed, this file attempts to send victim computer information to keep.regebky.com.

The file Awl.txt (MD5: C70F2812B22A222547EC5C551D3FC916) sends a DNS Request to keep.regebky.com on port 53 then sends a TCP connection to keep.regebky.com on port 80, with the following HTTP POST:
00000000 50 4f 53 54 20 2f 66 61 76 69 63 6f 6e 2e 69 63 POST /fa vicon.ic 00000010 6f 20 48 54 54 50 2f 31 2e 31 0d 0a 48 6f 73 74 o HTTP/1 .1..Host 00000020 3a 20 6b 65 65 70 2e 72 65 67 65 62 6b 79 2e 63 : keep.r egebky.c 00000030 6f 6d 0d 0a 43 6f 6e 74 65 6e 74 2d 4c 65 6e 67 om..Cont ent-Leng 00000040 74 68 3a 20 33 34 34 0d 0a 43 61 63 68 65 2d 43 th: 344. .Cache-C 00000050 6f 6e 74 72 6f 6c 3a 20 6e 6f 2d 63 61 63 68 65 ontrol: no-cache 00000060 0d 0a 0d 0a 00 55 aa 30 30 30 43 32 39 35 35 42 .....U.0 00C2955B 00000070 43 36 42 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 04 00 C6B..... ........ 00000080 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 c8 00 00 ........ ........
Traffic continues approximately every 120 seconds.
As of 29 December 2014, this domain resolved to IP 137.175.36.13.
